page.title: 13Landscape in the area
page.content:
The land around the{Waldringfield village is fertile and flat, sloping rapidly down to the river Deben. The river estaury is wide and tidal, with extensive mud flats and salt marshes in places (Hemley Saltings).
The{Shottisham area}is dominated by the reclaimed land near to the river Deben. Drainage ditches and earthworks to keep the water off the land are much in evidence. The land is very fertile and is used for intensive agriculture by the farm estates. The land gradually rises to the east , away from the river.
{Slide A}shows a view{looking East across the block.
